entry.title: Resolving Business Application Studio - BAS: - sh: 1: fiori: Permission denied
entry.content:
Problem:
While running SAPUI5 application in BAS, I am facing the below error:

sh: 1: fiori: Permission denied
Prerequisites:
Created a brand new SAPUI5 Freestyle application.

Configured necessary files:

ui5.yaml

ui5-local.yaml

ui5-deploy.yaml

package.json‚Äã
Runtime configuration is already set up.

Solution:

Run the following commands in the BAS Terminal:

 


rm -rf node_modules
npm install
npm run start-fixed
Before running the last command, ensure that your package.json includes the following script:


"start-fixed": "ui5 serve --port 8080"

entry.title: Adaptation editor for SAPUI5 adaptation project with VS Code - On Prem
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I‚Äôve created a UI5 adaptation project using the new Adaptation Editor generator (from the latest UI5 tooling update).

The project generation and build completed successfully without any errors.

However, when I try to preview or open the Adaptation Editor from my variant, the browser launches but:

  • The application does not render (blank page).

  • No UI5 controls or components are loaded.

  • The console doesn‚Äôt show any clear errors related to UI5 modules, but the app never initializes.

Here‚Äôs what I‚Äôve done and verified so far:

  1. Generated the adaptation project via the new generator (https://www.npmjs.com/package/@sap-ux/generator-adp)

  2. file .variant structure are correctly created.

  3. Verified that the base application loads normally outside of the adaptation project.

  4. Tried different browsers and cleared the cache ‚Äî same result.

Question:

  1. Has anyone experienced this behavior with the new Adaptation Editor generator ?
  2. Is there any known configuration or dependency missing to make the preview work properly ?

Any insights or troubleshooting steps would be greatly appreciated.

However, in the app documentation link above, I couldn‚Äôt find the ‚ÄúExtension‚Äù tab, does that mean that the app cannot be extended ? or is there another way to enable those fields in this app?

Thank you in advance for your help!

entry.title: SAP Fiori Elements Funktion Import Copy Row
entry.content:
I have a Fiori Elements app with a list report page and an object page. When I click the Copy one Row button on the list report page, a new row with the same values as the selected row is created. I am then automatically redirected to the object page, where I can edit the data in the new row. However, when I click Cancel, the new row is still displayed in the list even though I have not saved the data. How can I prevent this behavior?

  METHOD /iwbep/if_mgw_appl_srv_runtime~execute_action.
    DATA : ls_parameter        TYPE /iwbep/s_mgw_name_value_pair,
           ls_zleiter_ausnahme TYPE zleiter_ausnahme,
           ls_result           TYPE zleiter_ausnahme,
           ls_entity           TYPE  zcl_zodata_leiter_aus_mpc=>ts_leiterausnahmen,
           lt_entityset        TYPE zcl_zodata_leiter_aus_mpc=>tt_leiterausnahmen.

    IF iv_action_name = 'CopyRow'.

      "read parameters
      READ TABLE it_parameter INTO ls_parameter WITH KEY name = 'LA_ID'.
      READ TABLE it_parameter INTO DATA(ls_keys_app) WITH KEY name = 'APP_ID'.
      ls_zleiter_ausnahme-la_id = ls_parameter-value.
      ls_zleiter_ausnahme-app_id = ls_keys_app-value.


      "select new values
      "do you know - even if you haven't yet committed the changes,
      "system will return new data
      "search 'transaction isolation levels' to read more on this
      SELECT SINGLE * FROM zleiter_ausnahme
        WHERE  la_id = @LS_zleiter_ausnahme-la_id AND app_id = @LS_zleiter_ausnahme-app_id
        INTO CORRESPONDING FIELDS OF @LS_result .
      IF sy-subrc = 0.
        SELECT MAX( la_id ) FROM zleiter_ausnahme INTO @DATA(lv_id).
        ADD 1 TO lv_id.
        ls_result-la_id = lv_id.
        ls_result-la_datum = sy-datum.
        ls_result-la_aenderer = sy-uname.
     MODIFY zleiter_ausnahme FROM ls_result.

        DATA: ls_entityset LIKE LINE OF lt_entityset.

*      ls_entityset-aenderer = ls_result-la_aenderer.
        ls_entityset-aenderer = sy-uname.
        ls_entityset-bemerkung = ls_result-la_bemerkung.
*      ls_entityset-date = ls_result-la_datum.
        ls_entityset-date = sy-datum.
        ls_entityset-datefrom = ls_result-la_datum_von.
        ls_entityset-dateto = ls_result-la_datum_bis.
        ls_entityset-int2 = ls_result-la_id.
        ls_entityset-kostl = ls_result-la_kostl.
        ls_entityset-ktr = ls_result-la_ktr.
        ls_entityset-mandt = ls_result-mandt.
        ls_entityset-username = ls_result-la_nutzer.
        ls_entityset-int1 = ls_result-app_id.
        ls_entityset-app_description = ls_result-app_bezeichnung.

      APPEND ls_entityset TO lt_entityset.

* call methos copy_data_to_ref and export entity set data
        copy_data_to_ref( EXPORTING is_data = ls_entityset

                CHANGING cr_data = er_data ).
      ELSE.
        "Fehlerbehandlung - Quellrecord nicht gefunden
        RAISE EXCEPTION TYPE /iwbep/cx_mgw_busi_exception
          EXPORTING
            textid  = /iwbep/cx_mgw_busi_exception=>business_error
            message = 'Quelldatensatz nicht gefunden'.
      ENDIF.
    ENDIF .
**TRY.
*CALL METHOD SUPER->/IWBEP/IF_MGW_APPL_SRV_RUNTIME~EXECUTE_ACTION
**  EXPORTING
**    iv_action_name          =
**    it_parameter            =
**    io_tech_request_context =
**  IMPORTING
**    er_data                 =
*    .
** CATCH /iwbep/cx_mgw_busi_exception .
** CATCH /iwbep/cx_mgw_tech_exception .
**ENDTRY.
  ENDMETHOD.

entry.title: Unable to deploy application with cdm.json ‚Äì 404 errors in Build Work Zone
entry.content:
Hello,

Our project involves deploying a Fiori/UI5 application and its associated library to the BTP subaccount DEV_TAL (region: Europe Netherlands ‚Äì eu20), where deployments through BAS and Cloud Foundry normally succeed without errors. We are encountering persistent issues when attempting to migrate deployment of our application through a cdm.json in SAP Build Work Zone.

When deploying from SAP Business Application Studio via Cloud Foundry (mbt build > cf deploy app.mtar), the process works as expected: the application appears in the HTML5 Applications repository, can be managed in the Content Manager, and finally runs correctly when exposed in a site.

The difficulties arise specifically when switching to a CDM-based deployment. Our goal is to automate group and role creation and ensure consistent provisioning of application tiles. For testing, we are deploying a minimal MTA consisting of one application and one library. After setting up the CDM and RT destinations, creating the content provider, and assigning the required roles to both user and site, the tile appears correctly in Build Work Zone.

However, once launched, the application fails to load properly: in the HTML5 Applications repository, the application runs without errors ‚Äì the database not being connected is normal at this point. In Build Work Zone, the tile opens but the application immediately crashes with a flurry of 404 errors. As a result, the application does not boot at all, and the intended library resources remain inaccessible.

We have followed the official tutorial Designing UI5 Apps as Business Solution for SAP Build Work Zone and reproduced its GitHub template, but the outcome remains the same. The issue appears to be tied to the CDM integration and how the application accesses its library and resources once deployed in Build Work Zone.

 

 

 

Environment

  • Subaccount: DEV_TAL
  • Subdomain: dev-tal-ks9oev3t
  • Subaccount ID: 8b106794-ec42-4ee1-bacf-a039900b13cb
  • Tenant ID: 8b106794-ec42-4ee1-bacf-a039900b13cb
  • Org Name (CF): ARGONandCO_dev-tal-ks9oev3t
  • Org ID (CF): cafe0aa6-6373-455c-9dd1-f52e2e435364
  • Region: Europe (Netherlands) ‚Äì eu20
  • API Endpoint: https://api.cf.eu20-001.hana.ondemand.com
  • Space: dev

 

Reproduction Steps

  1. Run mbt to generate .mtar.
  2. Deploy via cf deploy app.mtar.
  3. Application appears in HTML5 Applications repository in cockpit.
  4. Create a Content Provider using both cdm and rt destinations
  5. Add role to both User and website
  6. Tile appears in BWZ.
  7. Launch the tile.

 

Observed Behavior

  • Tile name appears correctly in BWZ.
  • In the HTML5 Applications repository: application launches with its library
  • In the BWZ: application crashes and shows numerous 404 errors appear in the console.
  • Application does not boot.

 

Expected Behavior

  • Application should launch without errors.
  • Library should be available, and components should load.
  • Groups and roles should be automatically created by CDM.

 

Tests Performed

  • Added and removed the cap-ui prefix to all destinations: no effect, 404 errors persist.
  • Changed _schema-version between "3.1" and "3.2" and the the library path from "/cap-ui.argonuilib-1.0.0" to "/cap-ui.argonuilib", as per the template: no effect, same errors observed.

 

Attachments

  • cdm.json
  • mta.yaml
  • screenshots from BWZ and HTML5 error logs
  • manifests of both application and library
  • index.html of the application

 

References

  • Tutorial followed: Designing UI5 Apps as Business Solution for SAP Bu... - SAP Community (GitHub template reproduced).

 

Request

  • Confirm whether additional tenant-specific configuration (e.g. contentProvider mapping) is required.
  • Clarify which files are critical in CDM deployment that could block the process (mta.yaml, cdm.json, manifest.json, xs-app.json, ui5.yaml‚Ä¶).
  • Clarify the pathing necessary to and from the library from the application (e.g. resourceRoots in manifest.json, data-sap-ui-resourceroots in index.html, etc.).
  • Clarify where and when the sap.cloud.service should be attached to destinations

entry.title: SAPUI5 Date Input and UTC Conversion
entry.content:
Hi everyone,
I‚Äôm currently working as a SAPUI5 developer, and I wanted to open up a discussion (and hopefully learn from you all) about a challenge I keep running into:
DATE HANDLING in UI5/Fiori apps.
Whenever I encounter date fields ‚Äî whether it's in forms, tables, filters, or while sending/receiving dates via OData ‚Äî I get a bit anxious üòÖ. It's not like I haven't dealt with it before, but there always seems to be some unexpected issue:
  • Timezone differences
  • Formatting inconsistencies (backend vs frontend)
  • OData model quirks (Edm.Date vs Edm.DateTimeOffset)
  • Date pickers showing wrong values
  • Converting to UTC and back again

Scenario 1 - Reading Date from Date Picker ==> Whenever user selects any date from date picker, I want to get the UTC date.

For example - I am working in IST time zone and if I select the date 17-Oct-2025 in date picker and when I read it in my change event handler I get the date as 17-Oct-2025 based on local time zone. But when I tried to get the UTC date, it will be 16-Oct-2025. 

My expectation is when user selects 17-Oct-2025 irrespective of  local time zone, model property(VALID_TO) will be set to UTC date '17-08-2025T00:00:00Z'. I am doing something like this to achieve this.

Date Picker Code in UI view - 

 

<DatePicker value="{path:'localModel>VALID_TO',type: 'sap.ui.model.type.Date', constraints: { displayFormat: 'Date' }, formatOptions: {pattern: 'yyyy-MM-dd',  strictParsing: true, UTC: true }}" change="handleDateChange"  />
 

Date Change Event Handler - HandleDateChange in Controller

handleDateChange: function (oEvent) {
        var source = oEvent.getSource(),
          oTable = source.getParent(),          
          contextRow = oTable.getBindingContext("LocalModel").getPath() + "/VALID_TO",
          inputValue = source.getDateValue();
          //Get the Local Date Converted to UTC
          let utcDate = new Date(Date.UTC(inputValue.getFullYear(),inputValue.getMonth(),inputValue.getDate()));
          console.log(utcDate);
          this.getModel('LocalModel').setProperty(contextRow, utcDate);
      }
 This is working as expected. Your thoughts on this and if there is better way of doing it.
 
Scenario 2 - Using formatter to convert date object to UTC
Formatter Code - Check if date is defined and is a Date Object then format it as per UTC. I want to know if this is correct or there is other way of doing it. Also are there any other conditions which I should add apart from checking date instance. Or this will work in all scenarios.
Scenario 3 - Checking if input/parameter passed is Valid Date Object- Anything else we need to check or some other way of checking it.
Code - 
checkDateObject: function (date) {
      return date instanceof Date && !isNaN(date.getTime());
    }

I would like to hear your thoughts on the common date scenarios mentioned above. Additionally, please inform me whether the code provided above is useful or not.

Thanks,

Dhiraj More

entry.title: How to Download Adaptation Project Deployed to S/4HANA On-Premise System
entry.content:
For UI5 Apps and legacy UI5 Extension Projects, the project source is deployed to the UI5 ABAP Repository as a BSP Application, and program /UI5/UI5_REPOSITORY_LOAD can be used to download the source files in a ZIP file (at least those that were included in the deployment).

Adaptation Projects are deployed to the Layered Repository, not the UI5 ABAP Repository, and so the same program cannot be used. Is there an alternative program which can download the adaptation project source from the Layered Repository in a similar way? Is there a way to extract an adaptation project from an S/4HANA On-Premise system using Fiori Tools in BAS or VS Code?

entry.title: How to get all input fields from a fragment without using their IDs
entry.content:
Dear experts,

I know that getValue()works with specific control IDs, but I would like to retrieve all the input fields from a fragment without accessing each one by its ID.

Is there a recommended way to achieve this in SAPUI5?

Kind regards,
Lein

entry.title: SmartTable not displaying value text (Text Association) in SAPUI5 app embedded in MyInbox
entry.content:
Hi everyone,

 

I‚Äôm fairly new to SAPUI5 development, so please excuse me if my explanation isn‚Äôt perfectly professional yet üôÇ

I‚Äôm currently working on a freestyle SAPUI5 app that is embedded into MyInbox. In MyInbox, users can handle various tasks ‚Äî including invoice processing tasks.

My app is displayed for those invoice tasks and shows detailed invoice data.

 

What I‚Äôm trying to do

The app first shows invoice header data, and below that, it displays different SmartTables for navigation entities such as GLAccountItems, PurchaseOrderItems, etc.

One example SmartTable looks like this:

This works fine ‚Äî except for one detail:

When I show a field like CostCenter in a SmartField, I get something like this: 1234 (Development General)

But in the SmartTable, I only see: 1234

So the text description (value text) is missing in the table.

 

I‚Äôve learned that this topic is related to Text Associations in SAPUI5 / OData.

 

 

What I found in the metadata

The metadata for the CostCenter field contains a ValueList annotation, which defines its F4 help and seems to refer to a value list entity (VL_SH_FAC_COST_CENTERüòû

Picture 1

The referenced value list entity looks like this (simplified for readability):

Picture 2

From what I understand, sap:text="KTEXT" defines the link between the key (KOSTL) and its text. So I assume this is where the ‚ÄúDevelopment General‚Äù text comes from when using a SmartField.

 

 

Additional metadata section (possibly related)

There‚Äôs also another annotation on the same property that I don‚Äôt fully understand:

Picture 3

Does this Common.v1.Text annotation link the CostCenter key to its text value internally? And if yes ‚Äî why does it work in a SmartField but not inside a SmartTable column?

 

 

What I‚Äôve heard

Apparently, it might be possible to override or extend metadata annotations using a custom annotation file (for example, adding or redefining the com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1.Text term).

Would this be a valid approach to make the SmartTable also display the text value (e.g., 1234 (Development General)) instead of only the key?

 

 

My question

How can I make my SmartTable display both the key and the text (using the Text Association) for fields like CostCenter ‚Äî just like SmartField does?

If a custom annotation file is the right way, how exactly should it look like?

If you need additional metadata snippets, project settings, or controller code to help analyze this, I‚Äôm happy to share more details.

 

Thanks so much in advance for any help or best practices you can provide!

entry.title: Wrong tax calculation in MIRO
entry.content:
Hello,

I‚Äôve noticed a 0.01 EUR difference in tax calculation during MIRO posting.

Example:
Net amount = 164.35 EUR
Tax rate = 23%
Expected tax = 37.80 EUR
SAP calculated tax = 37.81 EUR

All item prices are entered with 2 decimals (12.52, 11.55, 8.80, each with 5 units), so this doesn‚Äôt seem to be caused by item-level rounding.

Any guidance on where to check or adjust would be appreciated.

Thank you!

entry.title: Fiori Elements list report controller extension typescript : editFlow().getView() does not work
entry.content:
I have created an fiori elements list report app and added a List Report controller extension using 'Page Map' feature of SAP Fiori Tools. I am using typescript and want to get the view instance of the current list report page. Here is my controller extension .ts code:

import ControllerExtension from 'sap/ui/core/mvc/ControllerExtension';
import ExtensionAPI from 'sap/fe/templates/ListReport/ExtensionAPI';
import Context from 'sap/ui/model/odata/v4/Context';
import EditFlow from 'sap/fe/core/controllerextensions/EditFlow';
import View from 'sap/ui/core/mvc/View';


/**
 * @namespace my.project.ext.controller
 * @controller
 */
export default class ListReportExt extends ControllerExtension<ExtensionAPI> {
	oView: View
	
	static overrides = {
		/**
		 * Called when a controller is instantiated and its View controls (if available) are already created.
		 * Can be used to modify the View before it is displayed, to bind event handlers and do other one-time initialization.
		 * @memberOf com.udhg.zprojectinfo.ext.controller.ListReportExt
		 */
		onInit(this: ListReportExt) {
			// you can access the Fiori elements extensionAPI via this.base.getExtensionAPI
			const model = this.base.getExtensionAPI().getModel();
			const extensionAPI = this.base.getExtensionAPI();
			this.oView = (this.base.getExtensionAPI().getEditFlow() as EditFlow).getView();
		},
		onAfterRendering(this: ListReportExt) {

		},
		routing: {
			onAfterBinding(this: ListReportExt)   {
				const EditFlow = this.base.getExtensionAPI().getEditFlow() 
			}
		}
	};
	
}

The getView() method on EditFlow instance is not recognized:

 

How can I make this work?

@Marian_Zeis @MioYasutake @AndreasKunz

entry.title: SAPUI5 App Changes Not Reflected After Transport to QAS Until User Cache Is Cleared
entry.content:
Hello experts, good day.

Has anyone experienced a similar situation to the one I‚Äôll describe below?

Here‚Äôs a brief overview of the scenario:

We developed a custom SAPUI5 application in the Development (DEV) environment. Everything worked correctly during the initial development and testing phases.

Afterward, we created a Workbench Transport Request to move the app from DEV to QAS for further testing.

The transport completed successfully ‚Äî no dumps or errors were raised. However, when reviewing the application in QAS, the latest changes are not visible.

Initially, we suspected a browser cache issue, so we cleared browser data and even tested in incognito mode, but the issue persisted ‚Äî the old version of the app was still shown.

After further analysis, we found that if we clear the SAP user cache, the latest changes appear correctly.

Has anyone else encountered a similar situation ‚Äî where clearing the user-specific cache is required for updated SAPUI5 content to appear?

This behavior could become problematic in the long run since multiple users will be accessing the app, and asking each one to clear their cache is not practical.

Any insights or recommendations on:

  • What might be causing this behavior?

  • Best practices or configuration tips to prevent it?

Thanks in advance for your time and support.

Best regards,
EBZ

entry.title: Flexible Programming Model sortOrder ignored by macros Table
entry.content:
Hello everyone,

I have a FPM project with first view containing macros Filterbar und Table.

The table displays the data, but ignores the CDS Annotation SortOrder from the PresentationVarian:

.presentationVariant: [{
qualifier: 'DefaultSorter',
sortOrder: [{ by: 'ManufacturingOrder', direction: #DESC }],
visualizations: [{type: #AS_LINEITEM }]
}]

I even added the property to the manifest file:

"defaultTemplateAnnotationPath": "com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1.PresentationVariant#DefaultSorter",

I can see in the oData metadata the annotation is present.

I am currently using the 1.120.0 version, but the same result is with 1.141.3

Is there any additional property expected by the macros table? In the API Dokumentation it is written :
Usually, a LineItem, PresentationVariant, or SelectionPresentationVariant annotation is expected, but the Table building block can also be used to display an EntitySet.
If a PresentationVariant is specified, then it must have UI.LineItem as the first property of the Visualizations.

 

Thanks for you help!

@Navin_Krishnan

entry.title: Unable to hide a custom field on the Pay component recurring HRIS element
entry.content:
Hello Experts,

We have a custom-double field called FTE calculated amount on the pay component recurring HRIS element and few of the countries have requested this field to be hidden. I have tried business rules with all possible scenarios (cross entity, onView, onInit etc) with different base objects Job information, compensation and pay component recurring however none of this is triggering the rule. Only the Always True in IF condition is hiding the field but this is not serving our purpose. 

Is this some kind of bug/known issue or anything that I am missing in the business rule?

Please advice. 

Thanks you ! 

Regards

Archana

entry.title: Smart Table with annotation.xml
entry.content:
Hello,

I created a freestyle application configured with an OData V2 service. After generating the project, I added an annotations.xml file to define the columns for my entity type. Then, I added a SmartTable controller bound to my entity.

However, the columns are not being displayed in the SmartTable.
Could you please help me understand what might be missing or incorrectly configured?

Thank you.

Main.view.xml

<mvc:View
    controllerName="dummy3.controller.Main"
    xmlns:mvc="sap.ui.core.mvc"
    xmlns="sap.m"
    xmlns:smartTable="sap.ui.comp.smarttable"
>
    <Page
        id="page"
        title="{i18n>title}"
    >
        <smartTable:SmartTable
            id="idSalesOrderSmartTable"
            entitySet="ZC_SALESORDER_HEADER"
            header="Sales Order"
            enableAutoBinding="true"
        />
    </Page>
</mvc:View>

Main.controller.ts

import SmartTable from "sap/ui/comp/smarttable/SmartTable";
import Controller from "sap/ui/core/mvc/Controller";
import ODataModel from "sap/ui/model/odata/v2/ODataModel";

/**
 * @namespace dummy3.controller
 */
export default class Main extends Controller {

    /*eslint-disable @typescript-eslint/no-empty-function*/
    public onInit(): void {

        const serviceUri = this.getOwnerComponent()!.getManifestEntry("/sap.app/dataSources").mainService.uri;
        console.log("serviceUri: " + serviceUri);
        const model = new ODataModel(serviceUri);

        this.getView()!.setModel(model);
    }
}

annotation0.xml

<edmx:Edmx xmlns:edmx="http://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/ns/edmx" Version="4.0">
    <edmx:Reference Uri="/sap/opu/odata/IWFND/CATALOGSERVICE;v=2/Vocabularies(TechnicalName='%2FIWBEP%2FVOC_COMMON',Version='0001',SAP__Origin='LOCAL')/$value">
        <edmx:Include Namespace="com.sap.vocabularies.Common.v1" Alias="Common"/>
    </edmx:Reference>
    <edmx:Reference Uri="/sap/opu/odata/IWFND/CATALOGSERVICE;v=2/Vocabularies(TechnicalName='%2FIWBEP%2FVOC_UI',Version='0001',SAP__Origin='LOCAL')/$value">
        <edmx:Include Namespace="com.sap.vocabularies.UI.v1" Alias="UI"/>
    </edmx:Reference>
    <edmx:Reference Uri="/sap/opu/odata/IWFND/CATALOGSERVICE;v=2/Vocabularies(TechnicalName='%2FIWBEP%2FVOC_COMMUNICATION',Version='0001',SAP__Origin='LOCAL')/$value">
        <edmx:Include Namespace="com.sap.vocabularies.Communication.v1" Alias="Communication"/>
    </edmx:Reference>
    <edmx:Reference Uri="/sap/opu/odata/sap/ZUI_CUSTOMERS_SRV_V2/$metadata">
